title: Fork Aitum Multistream to support macOS Keychain for stream keys
description: Modify Aitum Multistream plugin to store stream keys in macOS Keychain instead of plaintext in config.json. Touches ~3 spots in the code: multistream.cpp (read key at stream start), config-dialog.cpp (save key to Keychain), SaveSettings (don't write key to JSON). Config would store a keychain_service reference name instead of the raw key. Motivation: screen is always visible to viewers, keys should never appear in any file or UI.
notes: Implementation complete on feature/keychain-stream-keys branch in ~/code/obs-aitum-multistream. 5 commits: keychain helper (macOS Security framework), config save/load modified, CMakeLists updated, cross-platform fallback added. Stream keys stored in macOS Keychain, config.json only stores keychain_service reference. Backward compatible with plaintext keys.

title: Configure OBS settings
description: Set up video, output, and audio settings in OBS optimized for dual-streaming on M1 Mac Mini

title: Run OBS Auto-Configuration Wizard
description: Open OBS and run the auto-config wizard for initial setup

title: Configure video settings
description: Base resolution (monitor res), output resolution 1080p, FPS 30 to start (60 if machine handles it)

title: Configure output/encoder settings
description: Encoder: Apple VT H264 Hardware Encoder (M1 hardware encoding). Bitrate: 6000 kbps (meets both Twitch and YouTube). Audio bitrate: 160 kbps. Twitch simulcast rule: quality must be equal or better than YouTube stream.
notes: Apple VT H264 hardware encoder, 6000kbps, high profile

title: Configure audio settings
description: Set mic as input device. Set desktop audio for game/app sound.
notes: Rode Wireless GO II as mic input, desktop audio enabled, 48kHz stereo, noise suppression filter added

title: Set up stream controls (Touch Portal or Talon voice commands)
description: Options: 1) Free phone app like Touch Portal or Deckboard to control OBS scenes/audio. 2) Use Talon voice commands to control OBS - fits the voice accessibility angle of the stream. 3) Hardware: Stream Dock N4 (~$89). Voice commands via Talon is the most on-brand option.

title: Install and configure OBS Studio
description: OBS Studio is free, industry standard streaming software. Works on Mac. Set up different scenes for coding, rowing, and chatting. Download from obsproject.com.

title: Install noTunes to block Apple Music auto-launch
description: Already done! Installed via brew install --cask notunes and added to login items. Apple Music will no longer auto-launch.

title: Polish the stream
description: Add overlays, alerts, chat, hotkeys, audio filters

title: Add overlays and alerts
description: Set up overlays or alerts via Streamlabs or StreamElements (both support multistream)

title: Set up combined chat
description: Set up combined chat for both platforms (Restream chat or a tool like Chatty)

title: Configure hotkeys
description: Set up hotkeys for scene switching, mute, etc.

title: Add mic noise suppression filter
description: Add noise suppression filter to mic source. Test audio levels — mic should peak around -10 to -20 dB.
notes: Noise suppression filter added to Rode mic input

title: Set up multistream (YouTube + Twitch)
description: Configure simultaneous streaming to both platforms. Recommended: Aitum Multistream plugin (free, local, one encode). Alternatives: Restream.io or OBS Multiple Output.

title: Install Aitum Multistream plugin
description: Install from OBS Tools menu or obsproject.com. Open OBS > Tools > Aitum Multistream. Add Twitch output with RTMP URL and stream key. Add YouTube output with RTMP URL and stream key. Both streams share the same encoder — one encode, two outputs.

title: Configure Twitch output in Aitum
description: Add Twitch as an output target in Aitum Multistream with RTMP URL and stream key

title: Configure YouTube output in Aitum
description: Add YouTube as an output target in Aitum Multistream with RTMP URL and stream key

title: Set up accounts and stream keys
description: Create and configure Twitch and YouTube accounts, get stream keys, check upload speed, decide on peripherals

title: Create and configure Twitch account
description: Sign up at twitch.tv, set up profile, get stream key from Dashboard > Settings > Stream
notes: Twitch account configured, stream key obtained

title: Create and configure YouTube channel
description: Set up YouTube channel, enable live streaming (24hr verification wait for first-timers), get stream key from YouTube Studio > Go Live > Stream Settings
notes: YouTube channel created, waiting on 24hr live streaming verification

title: Check internet upload speed
description: Test upload speed, need 10+ Mbps for dual-streaming 1080p. Budget ~12 Mbps for two 6000 kbps streams with overhead. Use wired ethernet if possible.

title: Decide on and set up peripherals
description: Decide on webcam, microphone, lighting. Set up external audio (mic, headphones).

title: Buy webcam (Elgato Facecam Neo recommended, ~$99)
description: 1080p/60fps webcam for streaming. Elgato Facecam Neo is best value at $99. Alternatives: Logitech C920 ($99, 30fps), Logitech StreamCam ($150, 60fps). Will mount on top of large TV facing the streamer.

title: Buy lighting (ring light or key light)
description: Lighting matters more than camera quality. Budget: Neewer ring light (~$30-50). Better: Elgato Key Light Mini (~$80). Essential for looking good on stream.

title: Get webcam mount/tripod for TV
description: Need a clamp mount or small tripod to mount webcam at eye level on top of the large TV. ~$15-25.

title: Get ethernet adapter for stable streaming
description: Wired connection is much more reliable than WiFi for streaming. Need 10-15 Mbps upload minimum. USB-C to Ethernet adapter ~$15-20.

title: Consider green screen (optional, ~$30)
description: Collapsible popup green screen for background removal. Not essential to start but makes stream look more professional. ~$30.

title: Copy YouTube stream key
description: Open Chrome, go to YouTube Studio > Go Live > Stream Settings, copy the stream key. Paste it into OBS Settings > Stream or Aitum Multistream YouTube output.
notes: YouTube requires 24hr verification. Access requested Feb 22 at 12:28 PM. Stream key available ~Feb 23 12:28 PM.

title: Copy Twitch stream key
description: Open Chrome, go to Twitch Dashboard > Settings > Stream, copy the stream key. Paste it into OBS Settings > Stream or Aitum Multistream Twitch output.

title: Test and go live
description: Test recording, test streams on both platforms, verify everything works, then go live

title: Do a test recording
description: Record locally (not live) to check video quality, audio sync, framing

title: Test stream on both platforms
description: Do a private/unlisted test stream on BOTH YouTube and Twitch. Verify both platforms receive the feed. Monitor OBS stream health (dropped frames, bitrate).

title: Go live!
description: When happy with everything — hit Start Streaming and go live on both YouTube and Twitch simultaneously!

title: Set up OBS scenes
description: Create scenes with sources for streaming — main stream, starting soon, BRB

title: Create Main Stream scene
description: Add sources: Display Capture or Window Capture, Video Capture Device (webcam), Audio Input Capture (mic), Audio Output Capture (desktop audio). Arrange and resize in preview.
notes: Main Stream scene with display capture

title: Create Starting Soon and BRB scenes
description: Create a Starting Soon scene and a Be Right Back scene for transitions
notes: Starting Soon and Be Right Back scenes with text overlays
